alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 9:16PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lawrence, southwestern Cabell, western Lincoln and Wayne Counties through 1000 PM EST... At 916 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elamton, or near West Liberty, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Louisa, Wayne, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Barboursville, Fort Gay, Ranger, Burnaugh, Harts, Martha, Gill, Ulysses, East Lynn Lake, Charley, Centerville, Kiahsville, Dunlow and Hode. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 13 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
